XML-Introduction.sectionDescription: XML stands for Extensible Markup Language.

• It is a markup language much like HTML used to describe data. • XML tags or marks, are not predefined in XML. • You must define your own tags, so there for your could have any number of different tags. This makes it Extensible • XML is designed to store and transport data. • XML is a W3C (world wide web consortium) Recommendation. • XML is important to know, and very easy to learn. • Data types are defined in XML Schema Definition (XSD) files.
